name: Danielle Morgan
text: I LOVE Madewell. The store is always very well organized and the staff are super helpful - especially when trying on things and them knowing how they should fit. Great quality clothes. Recommend to everyone I know!

name: Brandi Russell
text:
I cannot say enough good things about Madewell.  It is my go to store for cool, effortless and flirty clothing.  Although it is known as the "twenty-something year old" version of J. Crew, both my mother and grandmother are always able to find fabulous pieces, and I will surely rock my items from here for years to come.

Most significantly, their jeans are made extremely well (hence, the befitting name) and come in a variety of both traditional and semi-trendy styles (i.e., ripped denim and fringed hems, but nothing overboard). I am a curvy 5'9 and I love that I am able to buy jeans straight from the store here.  I also love that they offer a plethora of stylish tops from reasonably priced basics to high end silk blouses.  I'm also very fond of their boot selection. I currently own 4 pair that still look brand new and feel amazing and I look forward to adding more to my wardrobe.  Lastly, Heather, the manager at this location, is amazing!!  She is very down to earth, personable and well versed in all things Madewell.

name: mae wetzel
text: Holy what!!! I've never been treated this poorly in a retail store in my whole life! Especially considering I had spent over 250$ there over the course of one week. Older blonde woman with god awful attitude treated me like a poor peddler when I asked to try on shoes, I even purchased some clothing and she was a witch while checking me out. Lady- you need to find your calling because it is NOT the service industry. I cannot believe Madewell would continue to employ someone like this- next time I shop madewell I'll just drive 2 hours to Atlanta because no one deserves to be treated that way.

text: Disappointed with the customer service at this boutique. All of the other bad reviews are right on. I made a purchase along with a pair of earrings and I wanted the earrings more than the shorts. When I received the package the earrings were not in the bag. Upon calling the store to see if it was an accident that they didn’t get put in with the package the little girl said, “well they must have fallen out bc it ‘says’ they were put in there. I’ll talk to the girl that packaged the order and have her call you on Monday.” 3 days later no call or follow up. Just goes to show they don’t care about their customers by all of the negative reviews.

text: I wanted to go in to just look around well the customer service was HORRIBLE and they were starring me up and down I just got done cleaning so I didn’t have any top notch clothes on to go look well I still go in they look at me the whole time like I was gonna steal something and I’d never do that and I heard a customer in the dressing room saying the pants were to much and the worker said yea well they are worth every penny with a attitude and she ended up not buying nothing either. they were over priced and very cluttered I didn’t buy anything and don’t plan on going back.

resp.text: Hey Nicole! I'm so sorry that you had such a bad experience. We try to give our customers a more personalized shopping experience and train our employees to be active and engage with customers so that we can offer our help if needed! We know there is a lot of inventory in the store and it can get overwhelming so we try to be as diligent as we can to meet our customers needs and be able to help them find everything they are looking for. It never has anything to do with thinking you are doing something wrong! If you have any questions or concerns please give us a call.

text: If I could give them negative stars I would!! Pricing is way over the top (not that I can’t afford) for the quality everything is. I came in to shop for a photoshoot, as I was trying items on, I was told I was too small to shop here and i needed to go to a child’s clothing store! Hated the attitudes I was given and felt so claustrophobic in there! Will not return after my experience!

name: Ryan VanSickle
text:
If you like spending $100 on jeans only to wear them twice before they rip then have the store refuse to do anything for you, this is the place for you.

At that particular price point, one would expect better quality products, along with better customer service. Sadly, neither were delivered. I asked who I believe to be the manager if she would be ok with spending $100 on jeans and only wear them twice then throw them away. She said, "not necessarily." So I asked, "but you are ok with me and your other customers doing that?" After that she simply answered a disingenuous "I'm sorry" over and over until I left, with no solutions or answers. Her pretentious and discourteous attitude spoke volumes about the customer service, or lack there of, at the store.

I certainly won't be back, but I encourage others to read the reviews prior to visiting (spoiler alert: mine isn't the only one like this). In today's retail atmosphere of "shop small", I would expect and appreciate genuine customer service.

text: I want to start by saying the only reason I give it 4 stars is because the staff wasn’t welcoming at the time, love the clothes but it made me want to shop else where because of how the staff was. When I went to try on stuff, which I was iffy about (covid-19), but I have to try on certain stuff. At first i was the only one in the store for a little while before a second person came in, I asked about the dressing room, girl went in to clean it sanitize which I appreciate. But if I’m about to buy something & I’m trying it on why is the staff asking how long I got in the dressing room she knocked on door more than once , like was there a time limit or something? she kept asking me other people need to try on stuff I’m thinking like it’s about 4 other rooms & then they told me once I go in I can’t go in but once.  With that being said I made sure that I took in all what I could & wanted to purchase. Like don’t rush I’m trying multiple pieces, come out it’s like one person with two other people sitting including a man, which he is not trying on stuff waiting. Manager kept making small comments to staff hardly spoke when I came in....I wanted to give them a piece of my mind but wasn’t worth my time,  hence store was only open about 45 mins when I arrived so I don’t want to hear anything about a long day. Would have never went into store but shop online but I needed something I didn’t want to wait To ship only to arrive with limited selection. name: Julie Stewart
text: If I could give one star, I definitely would. My daughter has never been "prom dress shopping", so this was a special event for her. We drove 2+ hours to Elan, and we were greeted as we entered the store. Everything else from that point was terrible. My daughter tried on several gowns and the salesgirl held the train on each dress as I took a photo of my daughter in it - never one time did she ever ask us not to take photos of the gowns. After my daughter had tried on about 4-5 dresses, one of the other salesgirls commented "we don't really like for y'all to take photos of the tags", to which I said I was sorry and we stopped taking photos of the tags on the gowns. I was unsure why, but I assume it is because their gowns are marked up well over retail. After my daughter tried on 1-2 more gowns, an older lady walked over to us and very rudely yelled at my daughter if she was taking pictures she would have to delete all of them before leaving the store. She also said "I know two of my girls have already told you to stop taking pictures". This is untrue, as the only person who had previously said anything was the salesgirl (not ours) that said not to take photos of the tags. I could see my daughter was very visibly upset, so we said thank you and left the store. They lost my business forever, as well as everyone I know that I can tell about our experience. My daughter commented when we left that she never wants to go prom dress shopping ever again, so I am really upset that these incredibly rude girls have ruined this experience for my daughter.

resp.text: This customer was not treated anything but wonderful in our store. She was greeted upon arrival and employees spent hours catering to her every need.  If mistreated the entire time no one would spend 2 hours in a store. Upon entry into our store on the front door and posted at every dressing room are NO photography signs. That is our store policy due to customers like this one.  Once a gown is purchased you are more than welcome to take all the photos you would like. This specific customers after being asked twice not to take photos continued to take pictures of Gown tags and photos of gowns. If you plan to purchase a gown in our store there would be no need to take photos of our tags. All of our gowns are priced the same as any other retailer so you will not find it cheaper unless it is a used product. After being asked repeatedly to not take photos and the customer blatantly in front of employees & other customers continuing to not follow store policy she was asked very politely by the store manager to please delete any photos taken in our store as it is against store policy. No one ever raised their voice at this customer nor were they mistreated in any way.  They were kindly asked to follow the store policy like every other customer. This customer then left our store after taking up hours of employees’ time, trying on our product, finding her correct size and went on resale sites posting exactly what size she needed and photos of herself in our merchandise in our store trying to find it at a used price. We are a small business trying to succeed after a struggle with Covid and customers like this one are the reason we have store policies in place to try to combat people taking advantage of hard working individuals and businesses.

name: JRB
text: I just had the displeasure of going into this store today. The level of unprofessionalism is ridiculous. You have one employee walking around with hair wraps that are made for wearing to bed or anywhere else other than while at work. The older AA lady was rude. She literally carried on a conversation with the other employee that was checking people out. Their conversation wasn’t work related nor appropriate. I could have sworn some choice words were used among them that little ears shouldn’t hear. She not only took my phone out of my hand to scan the barcode instead of verbally asking me to position it (big no no as if she dropped it, who would pay because I shouldn’t have to) but had to scan it again because she was too busy talking to the other employee. She never told me which card to insert (I was completing a return) nor the total (glad I knew ahead of time). Then she was very disrespectful by ripping the receipt off the register and extended her arm for me to retrieve it as she continued to speak to the other employee never looking my way. Who acts like that and they’re supposed to be in customer service? On top of all that, the line was extremely long and there was no a/c. I’m accustomed to shopping online and in the store where I’m from, but I’ll pass on this location.

name: Alice Blonskij
text: I’ve ordered 3 times and had issues with two of the orders. They said I had to file a claim with USPS for a lost package. They have very poor customer service, and I mean POOR! I’ll never order from them again, it’s disgusting how they treat people. Take your money and make you fight for the package I never received. Never had I received such disgusting service

name: leah turner
text: This has been an awful experience. I buy items to give to kids in third world countires. I bought tons of the clearance clothes. When I received the packages, the packing slip claimed all the clothes were in the package, but were not. I have tried over and over to call customer service, and the automated just hangs up over and over. I cannot get to a representative. I pushed the email button but it will not send me to an email. It just send me to the shopping home page. I want the items that I paid for now!

name: Brittney Catchings
text: This store is slow as hell in everything they do! It’s freakin crazy! Best bet would be to go to the one in Foley! Much nicer and faster ! Customer service is 10 times better too!!

name: L Ross
text: I like their clothes and they have good sales. I have ordered online and had items shipped to my home with no issues. I decided to order my child's school uniforms and have them shipped to the store. That was a HUGE mistake! The estimated delivery was between 8/3-8/5. It is 8/5 and my order status indicates it is still processing at the facility. When the order status hadn't changed by 8/3 I ordered back ups to pick up in store the same day. I waited to pick them up thinking my other order would be there. I was wrong and there were other people whose orders had not arrived. So they were scrambling around the small, messy, packed store trying to find school uniforms. Some of the store associates had attitudes and weren't helpful. I was very disappointed because they did not even have the items I ordered to purchase in the store. I know it's not the store's fault my order wasn't ready, but the store needs to be better organized.

name: Erin Clarke
text:
I love the clothes, but I refuse to shop in store here. Every interaction I've had in store has been unpleasant. The employees are very rude, the store is too small for the amount of things in it; you can barely walk around, the wait time is ridiculous, and the return/exchange policy is ridiculous. I couldn't find my receipt and needed to exchange some polo shirts for a different color bc my daughter's school changed their policy, they told me they could only exchange for the same exact size and color, why anyone would need the same exact shirt for an exchange is beyond me. I have given many chances to this store thinking maybe I just came at bad times, but each and every time
Its ALWAYS the same.

name: M B
text: This has to be their worst store location. I’m not sure as to why it’s still open in Mobile. They need to completely revamp their employees and store structure. No customer service at all. Ship to store pick up is even horrible here. Now, I just ship directly to my home.

text: Ordered my items online and only received 2 of 6 items. Had to argue with customer care to receive credit for my missing items. After receiving credit I reordered the items to pick up in store same day. Got to the store to pick up my order and the manager told me after waiting in line for 45 mins  they no longer had the items available because customers were still shopping in store after I placed my order online.

text: I normally love this store, even though it's pricey. But after today we will NEVER be back. I walked in to exchange a pair of boots my daughter got for Christmas yesterday still with the tags on. The moment I walked in, the sales lady, who was an older lady, was already giving me a go to hell look before I even spoke to her. She told me I had to go to another store and treated me like I had stolen the shoes. I wish I had caught her name because that lady should never be working with the public at all. I will be contacting corporate.

IF THEY SAY YOU OWE IT YOU OWE IT OR THEY DESTROY YOUR NICE CREDIT SCORE. The employees either took the items themselves or made a mistake when refunding them. name: Marquittia Bradford
text: There is a cashier there... her name may be Shelby.  I forgot to ask when I was checking out because she'd left for the day heading to the UAB library (I overheard her talking).  I called this morning to get her name but April (who said she was a manager) told me that she couldn't give me her name. The young lady this review is about is  African American and wears her hair in a natural afro type style. This young lady is a determent to your establishment.  Upon me arriving, I walked to the rear to inquire about a restroom.  In a very annoyed tone, she says "Ma'am is there something I can help you with back there?"  I walked from the dressing room and said "I was looking for a bathroom." I've visited the NYCO at the Summit and familiar with the bathroom being located near the dressing room.  Very snippy, she said "our bathroom is not open to the public try The Children's Place".  I said thank you and she begin to talk very sternly to another customer about a coupon that she could NOT accept.  So I left to head to the Children's place, and returned to hear this lady now talking to another customer about the mis-placement of a blouse/shirt.  I was eavesdropping, but I didn't have to try hard because the cashier has a loud, stern, firm voice and it echoed thru the building.  She pretty much was telling the patron that she would not give her a shirt for a price just because it was located in an area that had a sign for a less expensive cost. The message she conveyed may have been true, but again, her TONE and ATTITUDE were horrible.  The customer left quielty.  But that was not the end of the convo for your cashier.  Two other cashiers were talking in whispered voices with the young lady and they seemed to be trying to calm her down.  In her overly loud voice the cashier (again I think her name is Shelby but I do not recall), this young lady repeatedly yelled "she doesnt know who I AM!  I could be the regional manager!  I could have really shown her who I was, but I'm trying to be professional.  She and her mother...and she is this, and she is that...."  I was shopping in your store and there were at least 4 other customers inside the store at the time.  So her tone definitely disturbed our shopping experience. I just needed this to be known because it appears that this young lady thinks that her behavior is appropriate.   I was happy to see her go because I did not want her to check me out at the cash register. I hope the lady she was rude to reports her as well. It was inappropriate and lacked professionalism.

I was used to the employees here being pushy but left that day feeling very surprised and confused. Be careful because even my friend agrees they don't treat all people equally here. Overall, good store for buying home decor stuff

text: Very nice clothing and the staff is very helpful. Also if you’re an impulse buyer like myself, they have millions of random goodies to catch your eyes and you never know when you will find a treasure you have to have

name: Ashley Patterson
text: Went to francescas 10 minutes before they closed and knew exactly what I wanted. I was putting on the shoes making sure they fit when the lady who claimed to be the manager suggested I go to payless. I said by the time I walked over there they would be closed and she said “well we are closed too.” It was 8:50 and they close at 9. I bought my stuff and left and was out the door by 8:55. I’ve worked in restaurants that close at 10 and had people walk in at 9:55 and order food and keep us there until 11 or later and we only get paid 2 an hour. This “manager” should really work on her customer relations if she wants people to return.

name: Vanessa Brown
text: I love this boutique!

name: Donnamarie Roderick
text: It was our first visit to the Boutique and wasn't sure what to expect.  We were instantly welcomed by Rachel who asked what brought us in.  She then directed & assisted us in locating suitable dresses for my son's wedding.  She gave positive & honest feedback and helped us find the perfect dress for the occasion.  Not only was Rachel professional but her keen eye and her warm touch & positive spirit made our shopping experience  wonderful.  We are already planning for our next shopping trip. Rachel is Awesome!!!

name: JORDAN ROBERTS
text: Rachel and the family that owns the shop are phenomenal! I highly recommend their merchandise and from very high quality folks! :) They are very honest Christian folks that serve all the community very well and offer some awesome stuff!

resp.text: Thank you so much, Jordan!

name: Robin Bierworth
text: Fantastic place to shop! My friend and I were both looking for a dress for a wedding and had spent hours looking at several stores, her in North Carolina and me here in Huntsville. Neither of us could find any thing suitable. I found "Off the rack consignment" on line, best find!! They have a great selection, lots of sizes, good prices and are so helpful helping you pick out a selection to try on. Totally recommend the this shop.!!!!

resp.text: Thanks for shopping with us, Robin!

name: Hannah Long
text: Best customer service I have ever received. The prices are perfectly reasonable for the higher quality and more fashionable clothes. The owner is the sweetest person! I will definitely be back.

resp.text: Thank you, Hannah! We’re thrilled that you live Off The Rack!

text: Found a cute summer dress and some cute shoes to match for less than $20. Great prices.  Definitely worth stopping by this shop.

resp.text: Thanks Kayla!

text: Surprisingly nice products of high quality at very modest prices. Not like other consignment shops in this area. They stock a range and selection from elegant to casual at affordable prices. The staff is most helpful and friendly.

text: I have bought several formals from this boutique. Today they were a lifesaver with helping me find stylish, affordable, and up to date outfits for me to wear into the upcoming colder weather for work. They are extremely helpful, friendly & there to assist in anyway possible. I will continue to support this local business & look forward to shopping there again soon.

resp.text: Thank you Kelly! You are truly a valued customer of ours! We are so thankful for you! Have a great work trip!

name: Alicia Presley
text:
I needed a dress for an upcoming wedding and this place saved the day!
The selection was great with a mix of reasonably priced items and high end dresses, some still with tags attached.
The ladies were so amazing and helped me start to finish even with my pickiness 😁 I found the perfect one and highly recommend them!

resp.text: We are thrilled you found the perfect dress!

name: Amanda Faye
text: Gorgeous dresses at such reasonable prices! Homecoming, prom, and even some wedding! It's definitely my first stop for formal and semi-formal wear, and their casual clothes are so cute! I recommend it to all of my friends.

resp.text: Thank you, Amanda! We appreciate your business!

name: Allen Dobbs
text: Very helpful, and took time for us even as busy as they were, as if we were the only one's there! Awesome experience.  Will be back

resp.text: Thank you so much! We’re thrilled that you are pleased!

name: Susan Kay
text: Got the dresses I went there for. Great selection. I did end up feeling a bit rushed to finish up with the dressing room so someone else could use it..... Which I get, however.... I rushed up my decision, made the purchase and while still sitting in the parking lot the teenagers I had hurried up for were walking back out to their vehicles with no purchase made.......wouldn't stop me from shopping again!

resp.text: Susan, we are so sorry you felt rushed, that was not our intent. It does get crazy busy during prom season so we do our best to give everyone equal time in the dressing rooms. Thank you so much for your business and we appreciate your understanding. We’re always striving to improve so thank you for the feedback!

name: Lisa Potter
text: Don’t lie on the phone and say you don’t do consignment when it’s right on your website. Also, try not to sound so rude when answering the phone like it takes every ounce of you to be kind.

resp.text:
Lisa, we’re sorry you had a negative experience. We do consignment yes, but we don’t purchase items outright. Consignment means you still own the item (we don’t buy it from you) and then when it sells you get a percentage of the sale. So sorry for the confusion. We also apologize for coming across as rude, we were short handed today with people waiting to check out and our
human-ness must have come through, thank you for understanding and for your review. Have a great weekend!!

name: Nancy Godwin

resp.text: Hi Meshay P, we aim to deliver a great experience but as humans we sometimes miss the mark. We’ll strive to do better. Have a great day!

I decided to take them back and when I had bought them I payed $15 that was on a gift card and the rest in cash which was $80+. This was already way more money that I was expecting to pay which I also didn’t really have the money to pay that much but I did. So I took them back and got all of the money on gift cards which I didn’t need since the making of the shirts were poor quality. I asked them why this was and all they could say is it was there policy but didn’t tell me anything about it when I payed. I wanted the corporate number but I had already left so I called them and nobody answered it was just a automatic voice. So now I’m sitting here with $100+ dollars of gift cards that I don’t need when what I need is shirts to wear

name: Melissa Morris
text: If I could give more than five stars, I would! I went in for hiking shoes, not having done my research beforehand, and the sales associate knew her stuff and helped me. I can say two weeks later, after just finishing multiple hikes in Yosemite National Park and other challenging locations, these are the best hiking shoes that I have ever worn-water proof and all! They are perfect for what I needed. The associate also helped me find everyday shoes and the owner herself tried them on with me, so I could see them “on a model”, which was so incredibly helpful. The selection is wonderful, the staff is wonderful, and the owner was a delight to meet and be helped by, during a busy weekend day. I will never go anywhere else for shoes. Huntsville is super blessed to have this store!

name: Jill Campbell
text: You have saved my life! I had knee replacement surgery in November and afterward I developed Planters Fasciitis as well as Neuropathy.  I came into Valley Sole in pain in February. You took the time to find the perfect fit in Birkenstock’s and Aetrix. I was finally able to walk without pain! After about 2 weeks I could continue my knee physical therapy without foot pain. I could flatten my leg without heel pain.  I continue to wear my Birkenstock’s around the house because it just plain fills better.  My feet feel better at the end of the day! Other shoes, your feet hurt at the end of the day. You have a customer for life! Just bought 2 pair of Naot’s with the same foot support.  And they don’t look like everybody else’s shoes from department stores. Thank you so much!

name: Tonya & Robert Bickerstaff
text: First of all, I will start by saying that the store appeared very clean and has a good selection of different brands of shoes that are displayed nicely and I was greeted before I even got halfway through the door.  But those are the only positive things that I can say about my experience.  The sales lady immediately asked what I was looking for and I told her that I would just like to look around for a few minutes if that was ok because this was my first time in the store.  Well, I guess that wasn’t ok because she started asking me all of these questions.  I told her that I wanted to look at a pair of Birkenstock but that I had never had a pair before so I needed help with the sizing and no one in my area carried them and I had driven over an hour to come and look at them.  She immediately tried to get me to look at another name brand and told me she liked them better but I told her that I was there to look at Birkenstock.  I guess I got the wrong idea about this store, since I didn’t know my size I thought maybe they would measure my feet and actually try to help with a size but I left just as about confused as I did when I went in.  She kept changing her mind about what size she thought I needed.  She ended up telling me they didn’t have my size and color in stock which is ok because by this point I probably would have not bought them anyway and I don’t know how she even knew about the size when she kept changing her mind.  She told me that since I had never had Birkenstock before that there was going to be a break in period and that I still needed to look at the other name brand that she was trying to push.  I told her that I wasn’t stupid enough to pay $135 for a pair of shoes without reading up on them and doing a little research and that was exactly what I had done with the Birkenstock that I was interested in.  I wasn’t wanting to spend that kind of money that day just because I had nothing better to do, I knew exactly what I was wanting to look at.  She told me that she didn’t like Birkenstock because they hurt her feet but before I could get out of the store, she told me that she had two pairs that she loved.  What???  And if this was not already bad enough, at one point she left me standing barefoot in the middle of the store next to the Birkenstock display so she could go follow some lady around that was making a return that she had apparently helped a day or two before.  There was another associate that could have helped her.  And my sales lady was walking around with the shoe that I was needing to try on.  Needless to say, I don’t think I’ll ever be back and I would much rather shop at the small locally owned stores and with the craziness of the last year, you think they would appreciate your business but this store doesn’t need to count on me to keep them in business.

name: b wilson
text:
Valley Sole is AMAZING!  I have been shopping here for years! I will never shop for shoes anywhere else.  Holly & Julie are a wonderful team, they put their heart & soul into finding the perfect shoe for you.
Every shoe I own comes from Valley Sole  <3

name: Lela Morrow
text: Knew exactly what I was looking for and Valley Sole had come highly recommended.  The moment I entered the store, the associate was incredibly rude.  I brushed it off and gave her the benefit of doubt —everyone has a bad day.  However, the encounter continued when I told her which shoe & what size I needed.  She quickly popped off implying that I had never worn said brand, etc.  A younger associate came over to help and was very nice.  While VS had the exact shoe I was looking for (and I would have purchased in more than one color; I even asked to try on the colors I intended to purchase) and while I always try to shop local, I left the store—which is something I would normally never do—and went just down the road where I was able to make my purchases.   Small businesses hold a special place in my heart however if I am belittled from the moment I walk in the door, that’s certainly not a place that I want to do business.

resp.text: I am so sorry to hear about your experience. Yes, we all have bad days but our goal is always to not only help our customers find the perfect shoe but also to make a friend and be a bright spot in their day. Please send me an email to julie@valleysole.com so that we can make it right. Thank you for supporting local businesses, especially during this crazy time.

name: Christy Davies

name: S. Beltran
text:
I received outstanding personal service here in my search to find comfortable shoes. The friendly salesperson recognized when the shoe was a touch too big before I did! I found three pairs of perfect fitting shoes but alas, I only budgeted for one pair and a pair of Birkenstocks for my son. My husband now wants a pair of Birks. :)

I can’t believe it took me four years of driving past it on Airport before walking into this shoe store. I can’t wait to buy my next pair of shoes at Valley Soles! :)

name: Katie Thompson
text: Great store and tons of selection!  Came in for Birkenstocks, and left wanting so much more after trying on some different styles of different types of shoes.  They are so kind and helpful.  They truly want you to have happy feet and to feel good in your shoes.  Extremely personalized and very patient.  Can't say enough great things!  Definitely worth a visit ... you'll probably even walk out wearing your new shoes!

name: Brea Harris
text: I have looked everywhere for comfortable professional shoes to stand on for 10-hour days, and nothing seemed to work for me. I walked into Valley Shoes, and Julie listened well, understood my problem, and immediately took me to a new brand to try. The shoes she recommended fit so well and were so comfortable (and so cute!), and I'm excited to try them out at work. She was so helpful and friendly and even added a little extra padding because my foot is so thin. Best service I've had at a shoe store by far!!

name: Jackie Rettick
text: Great service, wonderful selection. Will definitely be returning upon future visits!

name: Ruth Martin
text: Shoe selection was great however I'm rating a one for service because when I walked in and stayed for a while looking around no one ever acknowledged me or asked if I needed help. It was very disappointing because I saw two pairs I would liked to have tried on but after 10 minutes with no offer of help I just left. They weren't very busy. The girls working there could have at least said, I will be with you in a few minutes.

resp.text:
Ruth,
You are absolutely right and I am so sorry. We have several new employees as we grow and expand but greeting a customer (even when you are helping other customers) is day 1 of training and should not happen ever. Will you please send me an email to julie@Valleysole.com so that I can get more info about your visit and get this corrected immediately? I hope that you will try shopping with us again and if you let me know when you are coming I would love to personally work with you. Thank you for for getting in touch and I sure hope you’ll come back.
Sincerely,
Julie

name: AM B
text: Awesome selection & service. Julie was an amazing help & I love, love, LOVE my new shoes!

name: Creative Palette
text: My 88 yr young mom gets swollen feet and ankles but still wants pretty shoes. Valley Sole hooked her up with some great sandals by revere that have strap extensions just for that problem. Great service! I love bringing my mom here for shoes because they are comfy, good looking and help keep her moving safely.

name: cj angeleyes
text: Excellent shoe selection & customer service! Support your local business owners! ✨

name: Tami Pearson
text: I can always find the shoes I want and the employees are always ready to help

name: Paige Parker
text: I had a wonderful experience at Valley Sole! I have plantar fasciitis/heel spurs & the ladies at Valley Sole knew exactly what I needed. They were so attentive & helpful. They have a great selection of shoes. But the best part is that for the first time in months, my feet feel great. I will definitely be back!

name: Paula Mulqueen
text: The service was attentive and friendly.  There is a wide selection of brands and styles. I had a good variety to choose from even though my foot is wide and difficult to fit.  The prices are very competitive.   I will definitely be back next time a need a pair of shoes.

name: michele pearce
text: I love this store!  I started calling on them as a sales representative and after spending time in the store, was soon very impressed with the professional sales people working there.  They know their products so well and treat every customer like they are the most important person.  And the products... they have such stylish shoes, boots and accessories, i can't help but shop there, even when i am supposed to be on a sales call.  I bought the cutest pair of Bussola boots last month and every time i wear them, I get a ton of compliments.  I highly recommend Valley Birkenstock Sole for anyone who enjoys a great shopping experience and wants the latest styles.

name: Meredith
text: Very disappointed in my experience today. I have been here before and the employees were helpful. I have read amazing reviews about customer service. Today, however, it was awful. I walked in and the two employees sat behind the desk and did not get up to offer any help. One was on their phone. In a store like this, I feel like I should not have to ask to try on a pair of shoes, I am usually being helped and they will offer to get me some to try on. It is not like a department store where you sometimes have to hunt down an employee. I probably should have just gone to one anyway. If I was the owner and had seen my employees being that lazy I probably would have fired them on the spot. Today, I was willing to drop $200 on shoes, and they had the ones I was looking for, but there was no way they were getting my sale.

resp.text:
Meredith,

I am so glad that you've had good experiences in the past and our goal is always to provide excellent customer service as well as unique products. I am so sorry for your bad experience yesterday. You are absolutely right, our ladies should be on their feet and ready to help! I have spoken with all of them and addressed this so that this will not happen again. We so appreciate you shopping local and I would love to personally help you next time you come in.

Thanks,
Julie

name: Lois Flowers
text: Love Valley Sole...the only store that has the best selection and cutest shoes that my customized orthotics can fit in.

name: Mentone Inn
text: I own. Bed n breakfast,  I am on my feet 16-18 hours a day sometimes.  My cousin told me about Valley Sole in Huntsville. As soon as I sleepless into the store the owner and staff were very helpful and made suggestions based on what I told them.  I was blown away by the customer service.  She made sure the fit was right and the correct support on my arch.  I live 75 miles away , but I will be coming back ,

name: Carolyn Seaman
text: I just had a great shopping experience at this store. I am very hard to fit and have literally been looking for a cute casual shoe with support for three months. Not only did they have something that fit me, but I had a choice! It was busy, but the staff was attentive and friendly. I will definitely go back.

name: Elizabeth Sheep
text: EXCELLENT customer service and great selection!  Will certainly be back!

name: Paula Dickinson
text: I've been here several times and like it more each time I shop.  I have really bad feet and have found quite a selection of stylish shoes that cater to your individual problem.  They also carry really comfortable orthotics for your old shoes.  The best thing about this shoe store is the service.  A clerk stays with you from the time you come in until you leave, helps you on and off with the shoes, etc.  They can special order a certain size or width and really try to satisfy you.  My feet are happy and it's nice to know there's a store here in Huntsville for people with special feet.

name: Daniel A. Williams
text: Great owner, great selection! Love this place

name: lorena iacobone
text: Great selection and awesome owners!! Will definitely be back!!

name: Zack Cullison
text: Drove all the way from Athens because they wouldn’t answer there phone. Apparently they don’t do that anymore.  Why put your phone number out there if you aren’t gonna answer it. It was better when it was the Birkenstock store.

name: Allison Ott
text:
I came in looking for good work shoes to help my bad back and I found exactly what I needed. The owner was very helpful, she helped me find exactly what I needed. She didn't help me out just for her benefit, it was to provide me with good shoes. Very pleased with my experience and would recommend them to anyone.
- Jesus Cordero

name: Julia Conner
text: Service was fantastic!  Sales staff very patient and worked with me until I got just the right pair of boots.  Highly recommend.

name: M F
text: A GREAT place to purchase shoes of ANY kind!  Not only Birkenstocks....they sell many other brands and styles for all occasions. Comfortable shoes for everyone. Locally owned and they seem to be genuinely concerned about the correct fit and shoe for their customers.  I highly recommend Valley Birkenstock Sole!

name: Wayne Fisher
text: The owners and the staff are awesome!  Very friendly, professional and most important knowledgeable.  Best of all, I now have super comfortable shoes that don't hurt my feet, woohoo!  I would not hesitate to recommend Valley Sole.

name: Erin Margarella
text: Great selection! Great service!

name: Patricia Huebner
text: What a lovely store!  A week ago my daughter-in-law asked me to go with her to buy  Birkenstock sandals for work.  She and I had never been to Valley Sole before and were pleasantly surprised.  Not only did they have a great selection but they were so nice and hospitable and really knew their products.  I got a warm vibe as soon as I walked in.  I ended up buying some for myself too and last weekend, went back with my mother to the store.  There aren't many stores with such nice customer service like this anymore.  Thank you!  I will be back!

name: Destiny Dennis
text: The employees were so helpful. They made sure I got just what I wanted. Definitely recommend this store.

name: Jeannie Vereen
text: I know it sounds dramatic, but the shoes and people at Valley Soul changed my life.  I was unable to sleep or find a comfortable position in which to sit or lie down.  Pain was shooting down my leg and foot and up my back and I was miserable 24/7. Finally I decided to go to Valley Soul to see if they could help me.  The employees listened carefully to what I had to say and then brought out several different shoes for me to try on.  It was amazing! My pain started to subside as soon as I put on their shoes.  Needless to say, I only buy from them now and highly recommend Valley Sole for their excellent caring and competent staff and collection of fabulous shoes!

name: Susan Cornelius
text: I always have a great experience at Valley Sole.  Great service.  They work hard to find the right shoe for me.  The shoes are so comfortable.

name: Pam Stapleton
text: My favorite shoe store! I love the selection -- they always have new styles that are different from the bigger stores. Holly and Julie are so knowledgeable and always help you find the perfect fit and the right inserts if you need them. Birkenstock, Naot, Picolinos, Clouds -- I highly recommend Valley Sole!

name: Ashley DeHaye
text: Really love the selection here and the staff has proven to be very knowledgeable every time I go. They don't just know what shoes they carry, they understand how those shoes fit different types of feet and what shoes might be best for lifestyle.

name: Brandi
text: Great store with a great selection!

name: Heather Reid
text: I had a great experience at Valley Birkenstock. I have wide feet and plantar fasciitis so I have difficulty finding shoes. The sales staff was helpful and knowledgeable and assisted me quickly to find Birkenstocks that fit great! I will definitely go back when I'm ready for another pair of shoes.The shoes are a little more expensive than what you find in department stores but I think this is probably a case of you get what you pay for.

name: Adrian McCobbie
text: Holly is sweet and very heloful. Good service great atmoshpere. I enjoy my time at Valley Sole. I give them 5 stars for service .

name: A. T. Hislop
text: After 20 years it was time to replace my Birkentock Boston's.  I headed to Valley Sole and was greeted with a very helpful and knowledgeable sales staff.  Not knowing what Birkenstock had to offer the salesperson went through all of the options and features.  This reinforced why I like to buy from a specialty store vs. online or department...it's the service you get!  I was able to order exactly what I wanted and I'd have to say that there is absolutely not way I'd be able do this on line and  it makes a big difference to see in person just what I would be getting.  In the process of our conversation I mentioned that I suffer from plantar fasciitis and it's a big part of why I love Birkenstock, for the support and comfort.  The salesperson lit up and mentioned that I have to try something...not that over the years, I've gone to local running stores and was offered several inserts that have been just OK.  And trust me, I've tried them all.  However, at Valley Sole I was introduced to BirkoSport inserts, which are very different...they essentially make any shoe feel like a Birkenstock.  Even if you don't suffer from any foot ailments, I'd try these, they are excellent and have several variations which would appear to meet any foot size/ shape etc.  I like these so much that I"m going to invest in several pairs and upgrade all of my shoes, dress, running, work boots, skates, etc.  Also, while I was at Valley Sole I was introduced to several very high quality brands and purchased 2 other pairs of casual shoes.  I'd recommend Valley Sole due to the quality products as well as the friendly and knowledgeable staff.

name: Gail Brown
text: Visited the store today and bought some of the wonderful SmartWool compression socks to wear on overseas flight to help prevent DVT.  Recently bought a pair of Naot shoes.  The employees were friendly and helpful.  Their inventory is always changing and they have trunk shoes from various reps from time to time.  I buy all my shoes from this store.  Have never had any problems with staff or products.  Would highly recommend store to friends, and frequently do!

name: Steve Mabb
text:
Just visited the Valley Birkenstock Sole store for a meet and great with customers and was very impressed with the staff and service provided.  The store looked great, was clean and tidy with a great range of stylish and comfortable brands.  Would recommend anyone looking for great shoes and sound advice to check it out - Holly, Julie and the team will take great care of you.  We are proud to have our brand represented in the store.

Steve Mabb
EVP
Orthaheel footwear

name: Sierra Landoll
text: Great friendly service 💗

name: Meredith Harrington
text: They didn't have a big enough choice of shoes.

resp.text: This is not a valid review. We are in touch with google to remove this false review.  It is written in response to a disgruntled ex employee soliciting friends to leave reviews.  Please ignore.

name: robin monroe
text: Great service and nice selection of shoes with great support. Thank you, Valley Sole !

name: Stacey McSweeney
text: I have a number of foot issues and I dreaded having to go in to buy orthotic shoes that would fit custom insoles, but I was pleasantly suprised by Valley Sole!  They have a great selection and can order so many additional shoes for you, as well.  The friendly and knowledgable sales associates helped me find shoes that fit my feet needs, as well as my sense of style.  While they have the styles you would expect, they have a nice selection of attractive, stylish shoes for a working professional.  Valley Sole is great about returns and even ordered another size for me when the original ones ordered ended up being too large.  I took one star off for price--these are pricer shoes and that can be hard to swallow.  But, the quality is much better and they are my go-to shoe store now, so it is worth the extra! I have been impressed thus far!

name: Martha Custer
text:
My husband has plantar fasciitis and I have been looking for a comfortable shoe for him.  I found Orthaheel on the internet and was trying to locate a store to buy them.  I phoned Valley Birkenstock and was told that they stocked them and they even checked sizes for me.  The next day we visited the store and were promptly greeted and offered assistance.  When I told the young lady what I was looking for, she remembered me calling the day before and even the size we were looking for.  She promptly brought out the shoes and talked with my husband about his plantar fasciitis problems. She brought out several other shoes, a compression sock and an ice pack- all to help with the plantar fasciitis.  My husband tried everything on and was so impressed with the feel of the Orthaheel that he wore them out of the store.

Julie was the young lady that was helping us and she was very knowledge about her products,and was very helpful with suggestions.  She was very kind & polite.  My husband is very pleased with all his purchases and says he will be going back soon to purchase more shoes (this coming from a man that hates to shop - especially for shoes) all because of the personal attention & helpfulness that he received.

This store really knows the definition of "Customer Service"!

name: Mandie Harrington
text: Amazing local business!

name: Sophia Muldrew
text:
I wish my first visit to Valley Birkenstock Sole on Airport Rd. in Huntsville, AL could be my last.
December 31, 2012 was my first visit to the store, it was about 4:30pm.
I made a purchase, the sales girl put the receipt in the shoe box.  On January 2, about 12:00pm, I went back with the unworn product, in the original box, receipt still in the box, to return the item.  (Note: A time lapse of less than 6 hours as they were closed on the 1st.)
I was told that I could not return it because it was sale merchandize.
The communication of that policy was extremely poor- it is not posted, the sale items are not marked, individually or as a group, and the sales people do not tell you verbally.
The only place that policy is communicated is on the sales receipt.  In addition, there are no prices on anything: sale or regular price items.

The store manager told the sales girl that she would take care of me, asked me to wait while she checked on something.  Returning to take care of me, she informed me that she had checked store records and since I was a regular customer I knew  about the "no return on sales merchandize" policy and therefore she could not help me.  (This should give you cause for concern, regular customers are given no preferential treatment.)
She offered for me to leave the item with her and said that if I did and walked out, she had no further obligation.
I continued to try to convince her that I was a new customer and had no idea about the policy.  I asked where it was posted, etc.  Her response was that in the state of Alabama it is "Buyer Beware".  I agreed that she could enforce that policy.

I asked if she typically opened the shoe box to read the receipt before she left stores so she could find "no return" policies, because that is the only way I could have discovered theirs. (I use the word 'discover' intentionally because this store seems to hide everything: prices, policies...)
I told her that reputation is important these days with internet data accessibility and that she left me with no alternative but to blog this occurrence.
Then she wrote me a receipt stating the amount I was owed I could spend in cash with that piece of paper and if I lost it there would be no effort of correction.

As if all of this, and the fact that I was now required to return, was not bad enough, when I turned to leave she told me that had I behaved differently she could have resolved this another way.  Basically, she did not like me (subjective) so she chose not to return my money.
THIS IS A HORRIBLE WAY TO RUN A BUSINESS!!  She just admitted to me that she could have given me what I asked for.  God forbid we do what the customer wants.
My thoughts are that their business model is failing.  The only reason to go in this store is to try on the shoes you want to purchase for a fit check and then go and purchase them at a discounted price on the internet.
The manager's justification from the other blogs--that it is a service oriented store is untrue.  The sales staff is so immature and inexperienced that they are a bother.  If you ask a price you are told, "oh it is about..."  About?  When I am shopping and spending these amounts of money, I want to know the exact price.
They seem to have lost sight of the personal aspect of the business and are overly concerned with money.  As an example, did they not think that the sales person (blogged earlier) could also be a customer?  Can they not relate that his experience, and mine, will be publicized for other people's benefit?
I have never been so poorly treated, ever.
What a shame I have to go back.

resp.text:
Dear Sophia,

Thanks for your feedback. Valley Birkenstock Sole is sorry to hear you are unhappy. We would like to help. Our policy for sale shoes is no return as these are priced for clearance.  Customers are told at the time of
purchase and it is stated on our receipts that SALE shoe purchases are final.
Normally we do not return sale shoes as is the policy, but it sounds like our manager accommodated you by giving you a store credit to purchase something else. When you return, if you will identify yourself to one of the owners, we will personally take care of you and make sure any questions or issues you have are addressed.
Valley Birkenstock Sole takes pride in well trained staff who offer full, sit down service.   I am sorry you did not have a pleasant experience in our store and we hope you will return to use your store credit very soon.

Best regards,
Julie Pierce and Holly McGinness, Owners

text: First time I went & my last, unless I can't avoid them.  The lady totally embarrassed me & was arrogant & RUDE!!?  Her shoes aren't worth that to me.

resp.text:
I am so terribly sorry for your bad experience. Please send me an email to info@valleysole.com or stop by the store so that we can talk about what happened. Our goal is always to love on our customers and I am so sorry that wasn't your experience.

Thanks,
Julie

I live at the beach so don’t wear fancy stuff often, but whenever I do, BB in Foley will be the go-to. Thanks Casey!

text: Great deals! Thank you for the military discount!

name: Shelby Adkison
text: We took advantage of the great specials and bought my husband a whole new wardrobe. Excellent customer and sales service! We had so much fun shopping. The ladies were so funny and engaging. We had such a lovely time.

text: Came in to purchase items for my brother and dad. There was only one other customer in the store. There was an older lady not doing much and a man assisting the only other customer. name: A1aerials Droner

name: Dani Cakes
text:
My son, who is kind of shy, had a school dance coming up so we were in need of a suit. We didn’t know where to start and neither my son nor I had any confidence in what to even look at.
When we walked in, Malcolm headed straight for us and instantly took us under his wing. He patiently spent close to an hour helping my son find the right fit, the right color (for his skin tone) and to match his date’s dress. We found everything we needed except for the tie. We were so very pleased with the purchase we made. But the most important thing we left with, was my son’s confidence! Malcolm told my son “to stand up straight, lift your head up, and be confident in the good looking guy that he is”
As a mom, to a shy teenage boy,  this means the world to me!
When we left to go find the tie at a different store, we were totally lost again. My son said “mom, do you think we can go get Malcolm to help us?” They may not ever see each other again but this guy with the exceptional customer service skills made a LIFELONG impact on my son. Express, I hope you realize how great of an employee you have in Malcolm. I wish the world was filled with more Malcolms.

text: Ok. The ladies who work at this location are the absolute best! They have always been extremely helpful when I need something for my wife. They also just helped me pull off a huge surprise for her birthday. I cannot say enough good things about them.

name: Lacey Graves
text: I arrived at this location at 6:02 in a Friday evening and their sign said they closed at 6pm. Not very good business hours for a Friday evening and how can they cater to the working woman? There was another customer inside and the doors we locked. I stood at the door and an associate finally came.  I explained I knew exactly what Iwas looking for.  A ring that was sold out online in my size.  I drove all the way from Decatur in hopes to find it.  I shared this and she said she couldn't let me in the store as they could only be open for so many hours. What does that even mean?  There was still a customer inside.  She closed the door on me and I was extremely disappointed. I am a long time customer of Brighton from Florida that just moved to the area.  I was happy to know there was a store close enough I could still spoil myself at.  I also work for a major retailer who does not close their doors till 15 minutes AFTER their posted hours.  Very poor customer service when retailers are struggling these days.  I will not revisit this location.  They have lost my future business.  I hope Brighton and the associates consider what customer service is to them, bending the rules just a little isn't bad for business.

When I came back to receive the offer of cash or store credit the same girl at the register mumbled the offer and I couldn’t hear her. I asked her to repeat, and she said it with even more of an attitude than the first time. She told me what they didn’t accept I could pick up “over there” not giving any instruction on where that would be. My husband and I walked around the counter looking for my items and could not find them. We asked her, “where are they?” And she acted like she didn’t hear us. So we just left. Whatever they didn’t take, they can have. Extremely unprofessional and I will not be back or recommend anyone else to do business with this company.

I was rather shocked. She clearly was rude, didn't listen and could care less. The manager is Kim and I plan to let her know. This was about 430pm. name: Keegan Williamson
text:
I can't believe all the negative reviews I'm seeing. Uptown is bar none, the best place in Dothan, or the tri-county area, to buy men's clothing. When I first moved to the area I immediately went to Plato's Closet to see what the Dothan branch had to offer, the short version is, not much. After going to Plato's several times in a 90 day time period and never finding anything of merit, a co-worker took me to Uptown Cheapskate one day before work. That's when it all made sense. The reason Plato's Closet was completely barren was because everybody went to Uptown, and I'm all for it because their price is easily half of what Plato's would charge and their selection is vastly superior.

I would also like to point out that the owner of Uptown has never been anything but extremely accommodating, courteous, and immensely helpful. If you don't like the value she gives you're clothing or accessories the solution is quite simple, shop elsewhere! As for me, when I'm able to not only buy two pairs of Bullhead pants(the clothing line has been discontinued since Pac-Sun went under and has become like finding a needle in a haystack) but also a beautiful yellow and blue Ralph Lauren cardigan, all for less than $30!? I know better than to look a gift horse in the mouth.

Truly leagues above their so called competition.

name: Emily Wilson
text:
01/16/2021

Claire’s
Shoppes at Bel Air
3464 Joe Treadwell Dr
Mobile, AL 36606

My daughter and I had been looking forward to our ‘Mommy-Daughter’ date for weeks.  Though I think that having your ears pierced is something of a right of passage that should happen in the pre-teen years, a step closer to becoming a young woman, and she is about half that age, I'm a sucker for my little girl and we decided this would be our event for the day.  I researched online and found a few places that were still offering this service despite this pandemic.  We finally landed on Claire's as it appeals to children in her age group.

As an added bonus to the day, my niece, who is just a few years older than my daughter, and my teenage nephew got to come with us.  Big Girl's Day and extra help to keep them wrangled.  We entered the store and asked a young woman sweeping the floor near a large unmarked puddle of water how to get started.  Without lifting her head she replied quickly, “you get in line," and stepped past us to keep sweeping.

Still unsure of what to do, my nephew saw the sign situated nearly above the entrance, something that wouldn't have been seen without guidance or turning around to leave.  After waiting in line for about 30 minutes for the 4 customers ahead of us to be seen, another employee asked for my driver's license.  I explained that I only have the temporary PDF version because I recently renewed it, but it is perfectly legal per Alabama Code.

"We have to have the paper copy," she said.

I argued, "But this is valid."

"I signed a contract for the company that says I have to have a paper copy of your license."

I stared, in awe, that she could say that to two excited young girls without even so much as a fake frown, but kept her face as blank and emotionless as Ben Stein's is when he verbally buries an opponent in a trivia competition.  My daughter's eyes welled with tears.  I quickly assured her that this is not a failed evening because I could call someone to bring their license from home and we could still get it done tonight.

We browsed the thousand's of items for sale while we waited for our help who was only 20 minutes away at most.  The glue-on nails and clearance jewelry was sure to extend the evening's fun.  It was hard to stay focused on the good time, however, when the first woman we spoke with that was sweeping the floors nearly ran into my daughter as she barreled past with a mop, then a few minutes later made a point to put a returned item back on the shelf directly behind my daughters feet, throwing it instead of placing it, and hitting my daughter's ankle.  A simple "sorry" may have helped my growing annoyance, but she said absolutely nothing at all.  Nothing.

Once our help arrived, we cheered together and made our way back to the now empty ear piercing line.  We waited for several minutes, but no one came to help us.  After trying to wave someone down, our hero with the license left us in line to find help.  He was told that they were closing in 10 minutes and needed to mop so they could go home, so they weren't going to do the piercing.

The look of defeat on my daughter broke my heart and while her cousins comforted her, I placed the souvenir's we intended to buy in addition to the starter earrings on the shelf closest to us and wasn't shy about letting my baby girl know that it's ok, and that because of the uncalled for, horrid way they treated us, we will never shop at a Claire's again, and will make the date a weekend long event by going elsewhere to get it done tomorrow.

I wanted to scream.  What purpose did the nasty attitude and horrendous customer service serve for Clarie's or their employees?  But instead of making my darling feel even worse by causing a scene and publicly scolding those wicked-acting women  like I wanted to, I decided to go the route of public shaming and posting our way-less-than-pleasant experience online for others to take into consideration when choosing the best place to share that memory with their babies.

Don't go to Claire's.  They suck.

name: Chuck Missildine
text: Very clean establishment. I literally did not see one piece of paper or similar debris on the floor. Shelves were nicely organized with price tags, clearance racks and store personel easy to find. Everyone (employees and customers alike) was wearing their masks and following social distancing guidelines which made the whole experience even more pleasant since I was shopping with several friends including my one year old great niece and a lifelong friend who has an extremely compromised  immune system from struggles with Crohn's disease. Scored a ton of bargains on name brands and designer's fashions. Seriously, I got my great niece a pair of sneakers and a pair of adorable boots for only $2 each. By the way, they were made by none other than the legendary JUICY COUTURE. I would have had to shell out another $45-$65 if I had purchased these designer's labels from elsewhere.  I felt practically criminal after swiping a game carrying case plus a glass screen protector (two separate items) for my son's NINTENDO SWITCH. I paid $5 for both which saved me about $15 and earned me HUGE POINTS with my son. How about this bit of awesomeness: $3 for Beyonce Pulse perfume, 3.4 ounce bottle, normally $15 or more. I also grabbed 2 hoodies for $1 each. And whatever you do, do NOT get me started on the huge savings and discounts I racked up on for the rest of the clothing that I bought as an early birthday present to myself.

text: Incompetent is one way to describe them. Went in and ordered my son a 40R Chamois jacket. In 3 days, we received a 42R Brown jacket. Wrong size AND color!! I call and I'm told they'll replace it with the right jacket. I have called 3 times for an update.  First one I'm told it's being shipped from CA. Second time, after being put on hold for over 10 mins I hang up. Call back and a manager, which put me on hold the previous time forever, tells me they can't replace it and Fedex lost my package. I've waited 3 weeks for them to get the right jacket and now I need one next week for my son's senior prom. Do Not shop at this place!!!!

text: Staff is very knowledgeable, versatile selection, affordable. The tape measure around the salesman's neck, I think his name was Adam, the pen in his mouth, his journal, the fit presentations and smiles are a nice touch. :) Great buys, 10 minute hem, no lies!

name: FeC ENG
text:
Overall, we had a good experience at the store, but it was a little odd.

We started out strong meeting a representative, Kate. Who greeted us, was quick, proactive, we liked her. But this other guy cut in and pushed her out. We (myself and the family) liked her. She was respectful, addressed us as soon as we walked in the door, gave us her name, and seemed really easy to work with. The other guy just felt like a salesmen.

We ALL wish we could have kept working with her. I, girlfriend to the stud getting the suits, wish the other guy did not push her out. I wanted her opinion. A young, fashionable, professional woman brings a lot to the table when it comes to attire. I would have respected her input. I hope the company allows her to work closely with clients in the future.

Please note that I have rented suits for myself from Men's Wearhouse so I am also a customer (being a woman in engineering, my friends end up being guys so I end up on the grooms side).

resp.text:
Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us.  We apologize for the service difference you experienced in our Birmingham location between Kate and the other associate.  Your shopping experience should be easy and stress free regardless of who you are working with.  We have forwarded this feedback to the management team for review and training purposes so we can improve.  We look forward to an opportunity to better serve you in the future.
Best Regards,
MW Listens

She ensured that I would be walking away with a suit once I got to VA regardless. I'm giving 5 stars now for her great customer service and the overall experience. But we shall see in three days of this service holds true!

name: Stephanie Williams-Velazquez
text: I went to pick a tuxedo for my nephew. I was picking it up because on the previous day when my nephew went to get it, it apparently had been sent to the wrong store. I get there and someone had picked it up from the correct store and neglected to call and inform him. I get to the place where suit was suppose to be and it is too big and no sizes to fit even though he was fitted weeks ago. It is a few hours until the wedding and this child has to wear this if his mom can't find a suit to match.

resp.text:
Hi Stephanie, we are sorry to learn that there were so many issues with your nephew's order. This is certainly not the kind of service that we aim to offer. We would love to help.
Please email us at MWListens@menswearhouse.com so we can follow up.
Best Regards,
MW Listens

name: Eric Campbell
text: Very attentive, professional and knowledgeable staff. All of my expectations were exceeded. Will shop there again.

name: smjaygal
text: NOT AL ALL CHEAP. That said, this place offers high quality clothing of the suit variety from shoes to shirts. We went here to get my husband fitted for wedding clothes and yes they do that for free and won't throw you out for looking like you can't afford a pocket square. I would absolutely recommend this chain for suit lovers who can afford to drop well over 700 on a full suit.

name: Izz Noland
text:
I have been 5 times already for registering and fitting for my wedding which is now only 5 days from today. My measurements were wrong the first time, so I went back and saw the manager. She measured again and changed everything. When I received my suit for the final fitting, everything was as per the original measurements and too big. They are supposed to overnight my new suit which I'll see 3 days before my wedding.
In addition, my son is very small, and I asked for the smallest fit. He received a regular slim fit instead of extreme slim fit which looks baggy. I was told by the person on duty that they don't have extreme slim fit for children (my son is 11, so I'm paying full price for his rental). I don't believe this to be true and will be speaking with the manager soon. I will not recommend them to anyone else. All of my groomsmen and father of the bride are using them, and the father of the bride at a different Men's Warehouse didn't receive his shoes. I can't believe we're paying $200 / person for all of the hiccups during the preparation phase.

EDIT / UPDATE - My new arrival came in a couple of days before my wedding and fit fine.  In the shuffle, the new order had a white shirt instead of ivory and I didn't realize until the day of my wedding that my shirt was ALL wrong!  Luckily Newnan in GA was able to fix me up.  My mom drove over an hour both ways to get me an ivory shirt.
Meanwhile, I'm waiting on my custom suit.  They were supposed to make up for ALL of this with a "special" custom suit, and there's nothing different about the one I am receiving versus any other Joe Custom Suit.  (mind you there were 7-8 in the bridal party who all rented suits from Men's Warehouses across the Southeast who all had some sort of issue).
I went in yesterday to pick up after my final fitting a week ago, and they had not touched it.  I was told on a Tuesday I could come get it on the weekend.  No calls, no emails, nothing.  So I go in AFTER the weekend and it had not been touched and they said, "wait 10 minutes and we'll have it ready."  NO!  I don't want my custom suit rushed.  I should add that customer service reply 4 months ago gave me a nice discount on my rental, and Kyla and David mean well at this location, but they can't, and shouldn't walk behind all of their employees.
This is the worst experience I've ever had with any establishment in the US. PERIOD. FULL STOP.

resp.text:
We appreciate you taking the time to share this feedback with us. We sincerely apologize for all the errors faced in getting the rental garments ready for such a special occasion. We have passed your feedback along to the upper management team for review and training purposes. We’d love the opportunity to connect with you and make up for this negative experience. If you'd like to discuss your visit with us in greater detail, please email us your wedding group details and best contact number or email at MWListens@menswearhouse.com so a member of our team can follow up with you.
Best Regards,
MW Listens

He greeted me as soon as I walked in the door. He spent alot of time with me making sure I got everything I needed, that it fit correctly, and looked good. His expertise is priceless and I will shop there again because of him. Great job  Marcus!

name: Christopher Godlewski
text: STAY AWAY!!  This place takes customer service and respect to a new low.  Purchased a jacket to wear IN MY OWN WEDDING, was promised to have it in 2 days . . . delayed going out of town just to get the jacket and it wasn't ready.  Had a bunch of items ordered for possible purchase; was told they'd be in on Wednesday and to just come on in.  Thought better of it and called, no sign of them.  Called back on Friday, the items had been there for days.  The Assistant Manager tells me "sorry, I work with a bunch of idiots".  He then tries to sell me a jacket that's not even close to fitting in the shoulders and tells me "I can just get it altered".  Anyone who knows anything about jackets knows if the shoulders don't fit, the jacket doesn't fit.  Tried to order even more items to exchange for a jacket I'd gotten, can't even get the AM to call me back after he again blamed the "part-timers" that work for him.  DON'T EVEN WASTE YOUR TIME HERE.  They should either close this branch or fire everyone and start over.

name: Chris Barry
text: I was impressed. First time to a Bham Men's Warehouse and was reluctant to visit this location based on previous reviews. New management has done a great job working to right the ship. John was an attentive and patient salesman.

name: Jamie Long
text: The staff here were very friendly and attentive. They were able to help us find what we were looking for in a timely manner.

name: Anthony Colón
text:
I am not having the best service to say the least. The buying process was great,  however, we are now almost a month out from my promised date for my custom made suit. Originally, I needed it for my graduation and was able to wear another suit for that event. They said customs take longer than the original date I was promised, May 9th. They said it would arrive on May 20th instead and I would receive a phone call. No call on that date, I called on the 23rd and it was there. They refitted my pants which is great, and the jacket fits perfect, but said it would arrive today, June 4th. It has not arrived yet.

I think the frustrating part is not that I don't have it, but that it is not ready by the promised date they said it would arrive. Perhaps, better communication would be helpful too. I have another event this weekend I would need it by and hope it arrives before the end of this week.

I feel this is a costly mistake on my end and will be wiser in any future purchases.

(Edit: wrote to email from Men's Warehouse a few days ago and haven't received a response.

Today, June 12th, I called the store and my suit was ready for pick-up. Again, why was I never contacted as they initially said they would reach out to me and let me know when it arrived?

Ideally, I would like to hear a response from Men's Warehouse and hopefully give them input so they can improve with their customer service.)

resp.text:
Anthony,
Thank you for bringing this to our attention. This is certainly not the level of service we strive to provide our customers with and we sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. We would love to reach out to the store and have your concern addressed. If you'd like to discuss your experience with us in greater detail, please email us at MWListens@menswearhouse.com so we can follow up.

text: This is by far the most unprofessional, lazy, piss poor excuse for a Men's Wearhouse I've ever seen. I had to leave it for another couple hours why they fixed it. Finally I get the suit and it fit like an $800 suit should. They bag it up, offer no apology for the troubles or delay, and send me on my way. I drive 2 hours home only to find that the idiots didn't bag the tie and pocket square purchased with the suit. I call to inquire about it and the "manager" says yea it's here....you can come pick it back up whenever you get a chance I don't really have another alternative for you. Talk about PISSED!!! Save yourself the trouble and steer clear of this location. The personnel from the top down obviously don't know the meaning of Customer Service.

text: I have dealt with this store in years past and everything went smooth and as expected. This time however was a totally different story. We are not doing the conventional rent a tux for the groomsman thing, we are buying pants, shirt, belt, tie, etc. for the guys since it will end being just as cheap or cheaper and everyone will have some new clothes. All that said we just wanted to get the shirts from them and buy all the other stuff elsewhere. From the beginning it was a fiasco and it never got any better. They are super nice, but they are incompetent, unorganized, unprofessional idiots. During my last visit the assistant manager actually argued, heated might I say, with a customer. They aren't able to keep up with what's going on and the other employees have no clue what the other is doing. How can you run this type of business without everyone in the store knowing what's going on, so when customer comes in to check on an order and no one on the floor knows what the other is doing. This is extremely frustrating and I doubt I will ever use the Men's Wearhouse franchise again due to this horrible experience.

One phone call to corporate the suit is magically found so my husband makes yet another trip to the store. Then once he picks the suit up the belt and dress shirt are missing which our receipt clearly states that he has already paid for. We purchased this suit in February and we are still dealing with them to get everything we paid for!! Will never go back once we get everything we have paid for!!!!
